p: The MIC represents the lowest concentration of antimicrobial agent that completely inhibits growth. Values are reported in percentage of LEO ( Table 4) revealing that the most resistant strain was P. fluorescens (MIC LEO = 3.75%, MIC GEN = 1.56 µg/mL), followed by E. coli (MIC LEO = 1.87%, MIC GEN = 3.12 µg/mL) and K. marina (MIC LEO = 1.87%, MIC GEN = 0.39 µg/mL), B. cereus (MIC LEO = 0.94%, MIC GEN = 1.56 µg/mL), and A. bohemicus (MIC LEO = 0.47%, MIC GEN = 0.08 µg/mL). No bacterial growth occurred in the sterility control, while regular growth was recorded in the negative control. In all strains tested, DMSO antibacterial activity was not present for the MIC LEO concentrations used.
